key_changes: Current phase changed from 'Create Seed Scripts' to 'Database Verification'
Last update timestamp advanced by ~5.5 minutes

patterns_discovered.description: Status file updates reflect completion of multiple subtasks (2 additional subtasks completed) in a single session
System progresses through distinct phases (Create Seed Scripts → Database Verification), with phase total adjusting as completion nears
Multiple sessions are used to complete related subtasks, with session numbers incrementing (session 3 to 5)
Active worker count remains at 0 while progress continues, indicating async or background execution

gotchas_discovered.description: Session jumped from 3 to 5, suggesting sessions 4 may exist or session counting includes parallel/background work not visible in this diff
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Review session numbering logic to understand execution model

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: Status File as Single Source of Truth
gotchas_discovered.description: All progress tracking relies on this single JSON file; concurrent updates could cause race conditions
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Implement file locking or atomic writes for status updates

gotchas_discovered.description: Microsecond-precision timestamps used without apparent synchronization mechanism across workers
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Consider using synchronized time source if multi-worker scenario emerges

recommendations.recommendation: Implement atomic updates to .auto-claude-status to prevent partial writes if process crashes
Add detailed logging of migration execution, seed data counts, and verification results to aid debugging
Document the session numbering scheme and explain why sessions 3→5 (clarify if session 4 exists)
Add validation tests to verify data counts match expected values post-seed
Consider extracting status management into a dedicated module rather than relying on file-based state
